metadata.title: Erowid Ketamine Vault : Effects
metadata.description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.

content:
Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Effects

                    Text: 
                    Contact

CHEMICALS

ketamine

Follow @Erowid on Instagram!

Ketamine

Effects

by Erowid

DURATION #

Caution : Reactions and experiences may vary dramatically from person to person. [see below]

Ketamine Duration Insufflated / Nasal Total Duration 45 - 60 mins Onset 5 - 15 mins Coming Up 10 - 30 mins Plateau 20 - 40 mins Coming Down 30 - 60 mins After Effects 1 - 3 hrs Hangover / Day After Possible Ketamine Duration IM Total Duration 30 - 60 mins Onset 1 - 5 mins Coming Up 5 - 20 mins Plateau 20 - 45 mins Coming Down 20 - 60 mins After Effects 2 - 4 hrs Hangover / Day After Possible

EFFECTS LIST #

POSITIVE

Pleasant mental and/or body high

Increase in energy

Euphoria

Sense of calm and serenity

Meaningful spiritual experiences

Enhanced sense of connection with the world (beings or objects)

Reduced or eliminated acute pain. ^

Visual, dream-like, visionary, and/or hallucinatory ideations.

NEUTRAL

(may be experienced as positive, negative or neutral depending on circumstance)


                    Context: 
                    This chunk is from Erowid's detailed effects profile page for ketamine, found within the site's Chemicals section. It provides specific information on ketamine's effects, including duration, onset, and a categorized list of positive, neutral, and negative experiences, to inform users about the range of responses to ketamine use.

metadata.title: Erowid Ketamine Vault : Effects
metadata.description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.

content:
Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Effects

                    Text: 
                    Reduced or eliminated acute pain. ^

Visual, dream-like, visionary, and/or hallucinatory ideations.

NEUTRAL

(may be experienced as positive, negative or neutral depending on circumstance)

Distortion or loss of sensory perceptions (common)

Closed- and open-eye visuals (common)

Dissociation of mind from body

Analgesia, numbness

Ataxia (loss of motor coordination)

Significant change in perception of time

Increase in heart rate

Slurred speech

Confusion, disorientation

Out-of-body experience

Shifts in perception of reality

"K-hole"; intense mind-body dissociation, out-of-body experiences, highly realistic visuals

Complete unconsciouness, sedation at high doses

NEGATIVE

(negative side effects increase with higher doses and frequent use)

Risk of psychological dependency

Nasal discomfort upon insufflation

Discomfort, pain or numbness at injection site (with IM)

Severe confusion, disorganised thinking

Paranoia and egocentrism (with regular use)

Nausea, vomiting


                    Context: 
                    This chunk lists the positive, neutral, and negative effects of ketamine as described in Erowid's "Ketamine Effects" section. It details a range of mental and physical experiences reported by users, from pain reduction and euphoria to dissociation, sensory distortion, and adverse effects such as psychological dependency and nausea, highlighting how these effects can vary by dose and individual.

metadata.title: Erowid Ketamine Vault : Effects
metadata.description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.

content:
Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Effects

                    Text: 
                    Nasal discomfort upon insufflation

Discomfort, pain or numbness at injection site (with IM)

Severe confusion, disorganised thinking

Paranoia and egocentrism (with regular use)

Nausea, vomiting

Visual, dream-like, visionary, and/or hallucinatory ideations.

Frightening or untimely distortion or loss of sensory perception

Susceptibility to accidents (from uncoordination and change in perception of body and time)

Severe dissociation, depersonalisation

Loss of consciousness (dangerous or fatal in wrong circumstances)

Depression of heart rate and respiration (risk increases with increased dose or when combined with depressants)

See Ketamine and Health for more information.

DESCRIPTION #


                    Context: 
                    This chunk lists the negative side effects and risks associated with ketamine use, particularly as dose or frequency increases. It appears within a larger summary of ketamine's effects, which also covers its positive and neutral effects, typical duration, descriptions of its subjective experiences (including the "K-hole"), and user experience excerpts. The document is an informational overview of ketamine's effects compiled by Erowid, including cautions and references.

metadata.title: Erowid Ketamine Vault : Effects
metadata.description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.

content:
Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Effects

                    Text: 
                    Depression of heart rate and respiration (risk increases with increased dose or when combined with depressants)

See Ketamine and Health for more information.

DESCRIPTION #

The effects of sub-anaesthetic doses of ketamine are generally reported to be pleasant, though if they are unexpectedly intense, they can be distressing. A well-known effect of ketamine at higher-range doses is the "K-hole", where the user is removed from reality and set adrift in an introspective dream-like world, often involving complete dissociation, immersive visuals and out-of-body experiences. At higher doses, the user can be incapacitated and unresponsive, or uncoordinated and erratic, appearing unwell to the uninitiated eye. Nausea and vomiting may also be present. While ketamine is not known to be physically addictive, prolonged use could be tolerance-building as well as leading to psychological dependency.

EXPERIENCE EXCERPTS #


                    Context: 
                    This section appears after listing ketamine’s negative effects and warnings, providing additional information about its general effects at different doses—including the “K-hole” experience, potential incapacitation, and risk of dependence—and is followed by firsthand user experience excerpts.

metadata.title: Erowid Ketamine Vault : Effects
metadata.description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.

content:
Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Effects

                    Text: 
                    EXPERIENCE EXCERPTS #

[insufflated, repeated] "[...] it was like I was pushed back a bit out of reality, making everything feel distant and even slightly unreal, typical dissociation. Everything seemed to be in a different angle, including myself. Also a certain unique visual distortion was noted, some grain and especially in the dark things seem to pull / slide in certain directions while never actually truly leaving their place. I often also physically feel this pulling and sliding too, especially if dosage increases, eventually if the dosage is high enough I will slide out of reality entirely, but this time the dose wasn't high enough for that so I would just feel like I floated around a bit, feeling unattached from my body the world and even certain parts of the mind." -- Exp 89492

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt appears in Erowid's ketamine effects overview, specifically in a section providing firsthand user experiences to illustrate the range of dissociative, perceptual, and psychological effects described elsewhere in the document. The experience narrative supplements clinical information on ketamine's positive, neutral, and negative effects, dosage, and cautions, offering a real-world example of ketamine's subjective impact.

metadata.title: Erowid Ketamine Vault : Effects
metadata.description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.

content:
Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Ketamine.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Effects

                    Text: 
                    CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid's effects information is a summary of data gathered from users, research, and other resources. This information is intended to describe the range of effects people report experiencing. Effects may vary dramatically from one person to another or one experience to another based on a variety of factors such as body chemistry, age, gender, physical health, dose, form of material, etc.

RELATED RESOURCES #

RELATED LINKS #

none

REFERENCES #

CESAR. Ketamine. University of Maryland Center for Substance Abuse Research. Accessed Oct 2007.

Various Authors. Erowid Experience Vaults Ketamine Reports. Accessed Oct 2007.

Karlow N, Schlaepfer CH, Stoll CRT, Doering M, Carpenter CR, Colditz GA, Motov S, Miller J, Schwarz ES. "A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis of Ketamine as an Alternative to Opioids for Acute Pain in the Emergency Department" Acad Emerg Med. 2018 Jul 18.

[ back to chemicals ] [ back to ketamine ]


                    Context: 
                    This section appears at the end of Erowid's summary on ketamine's effects, providing a disclaimer about the variability of user experiences, listing references for the information presented, and noting that there are no related links for further reading. It follows detailed descriptions of ketamine's duration, effects, and user experience excerpts.
